meanings.definition: A person who lavishes praise or compliments excessively.
meanings.sent1: The flatterers surrounded the king, showering him with compliments.
meanings.sent2: She knew the flatterers were only saying nice things to get something from her.
meanings.sent3: The group of flatterers tried to win over the teacher with endless praise.
meanings.sent4: The flatterers were like bees buzzing around the queen, always sweet-talking her.
meanings.sent5: The image of the flatterers fawning over the celebrity was hard to forget.

meanings.definition: Those who seek to gain favor through insincere praise.
meanings.sent1: Beware of the flatterers who only want something from you.
meanings.sent2: The flatterers at work always had something nice to say, but it felt fake.
meanings.sent3: The flatterers tried to win the competition by buttering up the judges.
meanings.sent4: The flatterers were like chameleons, changing colors to please whoever was in power.
meanings.sent5: The memory of the flatterers scheming behind the scenes lingered in her mind.
